description: Экран мониторинга времени безотказной работы виртуальных машин отображает данные о времени безотказной работы и времени простоя виртуальных машин. Ответственный:  Альбещенко М.Н. (АЦОД)

panels.description: This report displays the average planned downtime of a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Planned downtime
SELECT
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "Planned Downtime"
FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Planned downtime
SELECT
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS "Planned Downtime"
FROM
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_status, minutes_in_status, vm_id
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_status, minutes_in_status, vm_id 
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

panels.title: Virtual Machine Downtime (BR46)

panels.description: This report displays the average unplanned downtime of a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "Unplanned Downtime"
FROM
    (
        SELECT history_datetime, vm_status, minutes_in_status, vm_id
        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    ) AS samples
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

-- BR46 - This query returns for the specific vm
-- the total Unplanned_Downtime, Planned_Downtime, Uptime and total time in minutes.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS "Unplanned Downtime"
FROM
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_status, minutes_in_status, vm_id
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_status, minutes_in_status, vm_id 
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

panels.title: Virtual Machine Downtime (BR46)

panels.description: This report displays the average uptime and downtime of a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR46 - This query will return the weighted average uptime
-- and downtime data of each vm in a requested data center, 
-- and cluster for a requested period.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    vm_name,
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "planned_downtime",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "unplanned_downtime",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS "planned_downtime_in_time",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS "unplanned_downtime_in_time",
--  SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "total_time",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 1
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_in_min,
    create_date,
    update_date
FROM
    (
        SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status
        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    ) AS samples
    INNER JOIN v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id=
                samples.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
GROUP BY vm_name, create_date, update_date
ORDER BY vm_name

-- BR46 - This query will return the weighted average uptime
-- and downtime data of each vm in a requested data center, 
-- and cluster for a requested period.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    vm_name,
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS "planned_downtime",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS "unplanned_downtime",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status IN ( 2, 0 )
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS "planned_downtime_in_time",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS "unplanned_downtime_in_time",
--  SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS "total_time",
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 1
                    THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) AS uptime_in_min,
    create_date,
    update_date
FROM
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, minutes_in_status
            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
    INNER JOIN v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id=
                hourly_daily.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the vm id chosen by the user
    AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
GROUP BY vm_name, create_date, update_date
ORDER BY vm_name

panels.title: Virtual Machine Uptime (BR46)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text, vm_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms WHERE cluster_id IN ($cluster_id)
list.label: Virtual Machine
list.name: vm_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT vm_name AS __text, vm_id AS __value FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms WHERE cluster_id IN ($cluster_id)
